| Section3 = {{Chembox Hazards Solubility = MainHazards = FlashPt =
| Autoignition =
  }} }} 'Cyclic adenosine monophosphate' ('cAMP', 'cyclic AMP' or 3'-5'-cyclic
  adenosine monophosphate) is a second messenger important in many biological
  processes. cAMP is derived from adenosine triphosphate (ATP) and used for
  intracellular signal transduction in many different organisms, conveying the
  cAMP-dependent pathway.
